revision.comment: /* Semi-protected edit request on 24 November 2016 */ marking as Answered
revision.text: {{Skip to talk}} {{Talk header|noarchives=yes|search=no}} {{GA|17:00, 30 August 2013 (UTC)|topic=History|page=1|oldid=570833475}} {{User:MiszaBot/config |archiveheader = {{talkarchivenav}} |maxarchivesize = 125K |counter = 4 |minthreadsleft = 3 |algo = old(100d) |archive = Talk:Auschwitz concentration camp/Archive %(counter)d }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Jewish history|class=GA|importance=top}} {{WP Israel|class=GA|importance=top}} {{WikiProject Human rights|importance=high|class=GA}} {{WikiProject Germany|class=GA|importance=High}} {{WikiProject Poland|class=GA | b1 = no | b2 = yes | b3 = yes | b4 = yes | b5 = yes | b6 = yes |importance=High}} {{WikiProject World Heritage Sites|class=GA|importance=High}} {{WikiProject Correction and Detention Facilities|class=GA|importance=Top}} {{WikiProject Military History|class=GA |B-Class-1=no |B-Class-2=yes |B-Class-3=yes |B-Class-4=yes |B-Class-5=yes |German-task-force=yes|WWII-task-force=yes}} {{WikiProject Death|class=GA|importance=high}} }} {{OnThisDay|date1=2004-03-26|oldid1=3268132|date2=2005-01-27|oldid2=16335121|date3=2006-01-27|oldid3=36944953|date4=2007-01-27|oldid4=103516930|date5=2008-01-27|oldid5=187170895|date6=2011-01-27|oldid6=410419958|date7=2013-01-27|oldid7=534944075|date8=2015-01-27|oldid8=644355162}} {{OTRS-talk|otrs=https://ticket.wikimedia.org/otrs/index.pl?Action=AgentTicketZoom&TicketID=989004&ArticleID=1222637&QueueID=58|issue=Verifying the authority of [[User:USHMMwestheim]] to appropriately sublicense content he placed here from the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum|discuss=no}} {{Archive box|auto=yes|search=yes|bot=MiszaBot I|age=100}} [[Category:GA-Class Nazi Germany articles]] == Terrible English. == The article, being of paramount importance, is written in poor English. ‚Äî Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/89.68.208.252|89.68.208.252]] ([[User talk:89.68.208.252|talk]]) 08:59, 17 August 2016 (UTC) :Can you point to specific sentences or sections which you feel are poorly written? I've just skimmed some of it & can't see what you are referring to. :[[User:Gravuritas|Gravuritas]] ([[User talk:Gravuritas|talk]]) 21:22, 11 September 2016 (UTC) == Semi-protected edit request on 11 September 2016 == {{edit semi-protected|Auschwitz concentration camp|answered=yes}} On the page, under "Escapes, resistance, and the Allies' knowledge of the camps" under the "Birkenau revolt" it says that "250 Sonderkommando were killed" when it was actually 451. Langbein, Hermann. 1994. Against All Hope: Resistance in the Concentration Camps. Translated by H. Zohn. New York: Paragon House. Maher, Thomas V. "Threat, Resistance, and Collective Action: The Cases of Sobib√≥r, Treblinka, and Auschwitz." American Sociological Review 75, no. 2 (2010): 266. [[User:KingColeman23|KingColeman23]] ([[User talk:KingColeman23|talk]]) 20:29, 11 September 2016 (UTC) :Yes, the figure of 451 is already given over at [[Sonderkommando]], supported by three other online sources. [[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 21:13, 11 September 2016 (UTC) ::{{done}} -- [[User:Dane2007|Dane2007]] [[User talk:Dane2007|'''talk''']] 22:12, 11 September 2016 (UTC) {{reflist-talk}} == Gypsy Camp == This reference gives the figure killed when the Gypsy camp was demolished. The surviving population of 2,897 was then killed en masse in the gas chambers.{{sfn|Rees|2005|p=251}} Another source gives 5,600. Nazi Germany: Confronting the Myths By Catherine A. Epstein, pg 165. Should I include both, or just the higher figure, and state that there is a range?[[User:Guns of brixham|Guns of brixham]] ([[User talk:Guns of brixham|talk]]) 18:10, 17 September 2016 (UTC) {{reflist-talk}} :I will do it, since you don't know how to format citations. ‚Äî [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]] üçÅ ([[User talk:Diannaa|talk]]) 18:14, 17 September 2016 (UTC) == Death toll == Regarding my removal of content added to the lead by [[:User: Logicalgenius3]]. I don't think we shouldn present any one estimate in the lead as being definitive; please see the section "Death toll" for estimates of various historians. Also, saying in the info box that the facility had 1.125+ million inmates is misleading, as the number of prisoners varied widely at any given time. ‚Äî [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]] üçÅ ([[User talk:Diannaa|talk]]) 21:58, 13 November 2016 (UTC) :"don't" + "shouldn" = "should", but your whim ("I don't think") is not consistent with the Wipikedia's [[WP:SOURCES]] and prohibited ([[WP:OWN]]). You seem not reading the cited sources, but you should, and also must before baseless reverting, which is a blanking vandalism. Please, do read them. Those are not estimates, but credible calculations made several times by the Auschwitz commandant [[Rudolf H√∂ss]] himself before he was tortured, had nothing to gain from lying, and also confirmed by [http://www.nizkor.org/hweb/camps/auschwitz/crematoria/furnace-capacity-analysis.html accurately calculated capacity of the crematoria] - thus an estimate, but the actual figure. :The "Inmates" line refers to the total number and not at any given time (i.e. the capacity; who cares), as the "Killed" line does, and we know that almost all (1.125 M) killed were Jews, and only a handful survived, so the 1.125+ M number is accurate and much better that the word "mainly", which denotes not accurately. --[[User:Logicalgenius3|Logicalgenius3]] ([[User talk:Logicalgenius3|talk]]) 23:16, 13 November 2016 (UTC) ::There's a difference of opinion among scholars as to the death toll at Auschwitz. Please read the "Death toll" section for more information. H√∂ss's numbers are only one of many estimates and cannot be considered definitive in my opinion. ‚Äî [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]] üçÅ ([[User talk:Diannaa|talk]]) 00:36, 14 November 2016 (UTC) ::I agree with Dianna. [[User:Dr.K.|Dr.]] [[User talk:Dr.K.|K.]] 00:52, 14 November 2016 (UTC) :::Whether agree or disagree, you seem not to understand the difference in significance between the written account on 3 different occasions of a key witness/perpetrator confirmed by a scientific calculation from guesstimates of historians. Well, too bad - {{rpa}}, but hold some power at Wikipedia to its detriment.--[[User:Logicalgenius3|Logicalgenius3]] ([[User talk:Logicalgenius3|talk]]) 05:57, 14 November 2016 (UTC) :::: Experts include H√∂ss's claims in their considerations. It is not our job to judge who is correct, but only to report what good sources report. I agree with Diana too. [[User:Zero0000|Zero]][[User_talk:Zero0000|talk]] 13:03, 14 November 2016 (UTC) :::::1. [[User:Zero0000|Zero]], your input above is unacceptable, as: :::::*your statement "[e]xperts include H√∂ss's claims in their considerations" did not prove those considerations [[WP:RELIABLE]], as the experts' results differ (see [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]]'s above: "There's a difference of opinion among scholars...") proving their unreliability, as variation proves unreliability; :::::*your statement "[i]t is not our job to judge who is correct" is inconsistent with Wikipedia's [[WP:CONTEXTMATTERS]] policy requiring the editor to judge; :::::*your and [[User:Dr.K.]]'s statements "I agree with Diana too" and "I agree with Dianna" respectively claimed blind support and thus not consistent with [[WP:Talk page guidelines#Maintain Wikipedia policy]], as [[WP:CONSENSUS]] "does not mean... '''nor is it the result of a vote'''". :::::2. The [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]]'s statement above "[t]here's a difference of opinion among scholars as to the death toll at Auschwitz" automatically disqualified their output for the Wikipedia consideration, as not reliable [[WP:SOURCES]], because mutually contradictory and thus mere incompetent (careless) opinions ([[WP:CONTEXTMATTERS]]). So, the [[User:Dr.K.]]'s statement disproved his own position, as "difference of opinion" argued against his support of reliability. In other words, [[User:Dr.K.]] proved by himself that what he was rooting for not reliable sources. :::::3. '''Since''' - as [[User:Zero0000|Zero]] said - "[e]xperts include H√∂ss's claims in their considerations", than H√∂ss's claims are the only primary source ([[WP:PRIMARY]]), which additionally is confirmed by the scientific calculation of the crematoria's total output. '''But''' expert's claims are only secondary sources ([[WP:SECONDARY]]) and varying (thus unreliable), and the primary sources take precedence over secondary ('''[[WP:PRIMARY|"[a] primary source may only be used on Wikipedia to make straightforward, descriptive statements of facts..."]]''' which the number of dead is). '''Thus''', according to above mentioned Wikipedia's rules, and absence of reliable secondary sources, the only encyclopedic approach is to use the primary source and not the secondary ones based on that primary one, as they are unreliable (mere inconsistent opinions), because varying. :::::4. [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]] falsely reverted my edit of 01:48, 13 November 2016‚Äé claiming that "David Irving is not considered a reliable source" where the sources were by esteemed Professors [[Robert Jan van Pelt]] and [[Donald Bloxham]]. [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]] falsely reverted my edit of 21:35, 13 November 2016‚Äé claiming that "[w]e shouldn't present any one estimate in the lead as being definitive" where the data was not an estimate, but the accurate calculation for the primary source (H√∂ss). [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]] falsely reverted my edit of 23:32, 13 November 2016‚Äé‚Äé claiming that "Your edit has been challenged and removed. Per the [[WP:BRD]] cycle, you need to go to the talk page, where I have already started a discussion" where the inducing the [[WP:BRD]] cycle was based on said 2 false reverts ("challenges"). In other words, [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]] falsely reverts 2 edits and than, based on those false challenges induces thus falsely the [[WP:BRD]] cycle. It is very clever single-editor [[WP:OWNBEHAVIOR]] prohibited by Wikipedia. Then, [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]]'s [[WP:OWNBEHAVIOR]] gets blind support from [[User:Dr.K.]] and [[User:Zero0000|Zero]], which thus are multiple-editor [[WP:OWNBEHAVIOR]]. :::::This is how you justify a Wikipedia's position. Wikipedia is not a subject to personal [[WP:OWNERSHIP]]. Please, do follow the Wikipedia's rules.--[[User:Logicalgenius3|Logicalgenius3]] ([[User talk:Logicalgenius3|talk]]) 02:11, 15 November 2016 (UTC) ::::::There are seven sure-fire indicators of [[WP:POVPUSH|POV-pushing]]. They are: 1. Use of blatantly partisan and unreliable sources 2. Relentless edit-warring to support the partisan and unreliable sources in part 1. 3. [[special:diff/749417968|Personal attacks]] to support parts 1 and 2. 4. Walls of text. 5. [[special:diff/749556086|Unsuccessful attempts to change the RS core policy of Wikipedia while in a dispute about reliable sources with other editors]]. 6. Noone on wiki agrees with you. And, finally, 7. Your edits get reverted repeatedly by multiple editors across several articles. I think all seven apply to you in [[WP:SPADE|spades]]. In this case, there is only one way out: [[WP:STICK|You should reconsider your attitude]]. [[User:Dr.K.|Dr.]] [[User talk:Dr.K.|K.]] 03:01, 15 November 2016 (UTC) :::::::To clarify, is H√∂ss being considered by editor Logicalgenius3 to be a reliable source? [[User:K.e.coffman|K.e.coffman]] ([[User talk:K.e.coffman|talk]]) 03:39, 15 November 2016 (UTC) ::::::::Yes [[User:K.e.coffman|K.e.coffman]], as being a murderer does not make one a lair, like in the case of H√∂ss, whose initial 3 testimonies included detailed calculations, were scientifically verified, and thus are the only primary source the best contemporary historians rely on, as shown [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Auschwitz_concentration_camp&oldid=749362095 here by citations (1), (2), and (3)]. Simply, H√∂ss had nothing to gain from laying since it did not matter how many millions of deaths he commanded. Adding speculations of old-school historians over H√∂ss's account adds only another layer of uncertainty, which decreases the credibility of the actual number anyway derived only from H√∂ss. Thus, citing other sources than those from esteemed professors and based only on H√∂ss's initial 3 testimonies is less accurate than old-school speculations, and thus not encyclopedic. That is the essence of the issue here. You can check everything over, as all is verifiable.--01:14, 16 November 2016 (UTC) ::::::::: You are doing [[WP:NOR|original research]] here. Who are you to say that a mass murdered would not have a motive for lying? [[User:Zero0000|Zero]][[User_talk:Zero0000|talk]] 02:10, 16 November 2016 (UTC) ::::::::::No, it is by [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Auschwitz_concentration_camp&oldid=749362095 here by citations (1), (2)] (especially the footnote 76 of [2]) by [[Robert Jan van Pelt]] and [[Donald Bloxham]]. BTW, you need to do some checking before opposing anything or just participating in a discussion instead of just waiting for someone to explain the content of the links provided just above and available by just clicking on the links.--[[User:Logicalgenius3|Logicalgenius3]] ([[User talk:Logicalgenius3|talk]]) 01:51, 17 November 2016 (UTC) {{outdent}} I have undone {{diff|Auschwitz concentration camp|749968464|749372414|this edit}} because we can't say in Wikipedia's voice that the data on the museum website is official. The fact that the museums accepts 1.1 million as the official death toll is already present in the article in the section where we discuss the various death toll estimates, and I have added as an explanatory note their breakdown by ethnicity. I've also moved their estimate of 1.3 million total number of prisoners to a different place in the article and stated that it's their data. ‚Äî [[User:Diannaa|Diannaa]] üçÅ ([[User talk:Diannaa|talk]]) 06:33, 17 November 2016 (UTC) == Semi-protected edit request on 24 November 2016 == {{edit semi-protected|Auschwitz concentration camp|answered=yes}} Please add the following external resource: The Nazi Concentration camps: a teaching and learning resource about Auschwitz and other Nazi camps (University of London) http://www.camps.bbk.ac.uk/index.html [[User:Scholar792|Scholar792]] ([[User talk:Scholar792|talk]]) 15:21, 24 November 2016 (UTC) * ''(Transcluded from [[Talk:Nazi concentration camps#November 24, 2016 revert]])'' User {{user2|Scholar792}} (today's 8 edits, total) is and SPA created to promote a brand new website http://www.camps.bbk.ac.uk/ teaching and learning resource based on text by [[Nikolaus Wachsmann]], Professor in history at London University‚Äôs Birkbeck College, author of recently published ''KL: A History of the Nazi Concentration Camps'' (2015, 865 pages).[http://www.camps.bbk.ac.uk/about.html] ‚Äî Professor [[Timothy Snyder]] of Yale University (paid per view, at Wall Street Journal) describes Wachsmann as a 'revisionist' from "the best of the German and the British schools of grand World War II history."[http://www.wsj.com/articles/memoirs-of-the-murdered-1429909684] Please keep an eye on it. ‚Äî Thomas Laqueur wrote that "Wachsmann estimates there were 560 [satelite camps ... meanwhile]; a survey in 1990 based on an earlier report by the Allies has a much higher figure and runs to nearly 700 pages of small type."[http://www.lrb.co.uk/v37/n18/thomas-laqueur/devoted-to-terror] The numbers don't add up. ‚Äî Professor Ferenc Lacz√≥ of Maastricht University writes that "while pointing to institutional and organizational connections between the KL system and the three Globocnik death camps, Wachsmann discusses the latter sites only briefly ... some of ''KL‚Äôs'' emphases may also be debatable" such as the insistence on ''[[Konzentrationslager]]'' (KL) uniqueness.[http://www.academia.edu/19046297/Nikolaus_Wachsmann_KL._A_History_of_the_Nazi_Concentration_Camps] '''[[User:Poeticbent|Poeticbent]]''' [[User_talk:Poeticbent|talk]] 16:54, 24 November 2016 (UTC) **I am marking this request as Answered, because the source does not look useful. The data added to [[Nazi concentration camps]] from this source differs widely from other sources and has been removed by another editor. ‚Äî [[User:Ninja Diannaa|Ninja Diannaa]] ([[User talk:Ninja Diannaa|Talk]]) 17:38, 24 November 2016 (UTC)
